section.p: Error codes indicate that the SDK has encountered an unrecoverable error and requires intervention from the application. For example, an error is returned when the camera fails to open, and the app needs to prompt the user that the camera cannot be used.

Error codes indicate that the SDK encountered an unrecoverable error and requires intervention from the application. For example, an error is returned when the camera fails to open, and the app needs to inform the user that the camera cannot be used.

Error codes indicate that the SDK has encountered an unrecoverable error requiring application intervention. For example, an error is returned when the camera fails to open, and the app needs to notify the user that the camera cannot be used.

Error codes indicate that the SDK has encountered an unrecoverable error and requires intervention from the application. For example, an error is returned when the camera fails to open, and the app needs to notify the user that the camera cannot be used.

plentry.pd: 0: No error.
1: A general error (no specific classification of the error cause). Please try calling the method again.
2: An invalid parameter was set in the method. For example, the specified channel name contains illegal characters. Please reset the parameter.

3: The SDK is not ready. Possible reasons:
failed to initialize. Please reinitialize .
The user has not joined the channel when calling the method. Please check the method call logic.
The user has not left the channel when calling the or method. Please check the method call logic.
The audio module is not enabled.
The assembly is incomplete.

4: The current state of does not support this operation. Possible reasons:
When using built-in encryption, the encryption mode is incorrect, or loading the external encryption library failed. Please check whether the encryption enum value is correct or reload the external encryption library.

5: This method call was rejected. Possible reasons:
failed to initialize. Please reinitialize .
The channel name was set to an empty string "" when joining the channel. Please reset the channel name.
In multi-channel scenarios, the channel name already exists when calling to join a channel. Please reset the channel name.
6: The buffer size is insufficient to store the returned data.
7: The method was called before was initialized. Please ensure that the object is created and initialized before calling this method.
8: The current state is invalid.
9: No permission to operate. Please check whether the user has granted the app permission to use audio and video devices.
10: Method call timed out. Some method calls require a response from the SDK. If the SDK takes too long to process the event and does not return within 10 seconds, this error occurs.

17: Joining the channel was rejected. Possible reasons:
The user is already in the channel. It is recommended to determine whether the user is in the channel via the callback. Do not call this method again to join the channel unless receiving the ConnectionStateDisconnected(1) state.
The user attempted to join the channel without calling after initiating a call test with . After starting a call test, you must call to end the current test before joining the channel.

18: Failed to leave the channel. Possible reasons:
The user has already left the channel before calling . Stop calling this method.
The user called before joining the channel. No additional action is needed in this case.
19: The resource is already in use and cannot be reused.
20: The SDK aborted the request, possibly due to too many requests.
21: On Windows, specific firewall settings caused to fail initialization and crash.
22: The SDK failed to allocate resources, possibly because the app is using too many resources or system resources are exhausted.
101: Invalid App ID. Please use a valid App ID to rejoin the channel.
102: Invalid channel name. Possible reason is an incorrect data type for the parameter. Please use a valid channel name to rejoin the channel.
103: Unable to obtain server resources in the current region. Try specifying another region when initializing .

109: The current Token has expired and is no longer valid. Please request a new Token from your server and call to update the Token. Deprecated: This enum is deprecated. Use the ConnectionChangedTokenExpired(9) in the callback instead.

pd.note: Deprecated: This enum is deprecated. Use the ConnectionChangedInvalidToken(8) in the callback instead.

ul.li: App certificate is enabled in the console, but App ID + Token authentication is not used. When the project has App certificate enabled, Token authentication must be used.
The uid field used when generating the Token does not match the uid used when joining the channel.

plentry.pd: 111: Network connection interrupted. After the SDK establishes a connection with the server, it loses the network connection for more than 4 seconds.
112: Network connection lost. The network is disconnected and the SDK fails to reconnect to the server within 10 seconds.
113: The user is not in the channel when calling the method.
114: The data length exceeds 1 KB when calling .
115: The data sending frequency exceeds the limit (6 KB/s) when calling .
116: The number of data streams created exceeds the limit (5 streams) when calling .
117: Data stream sending timed out.
119: Failed to switch user role. Please try rejoining the channel.

120: Media stream decryption failed. Possibly due to an incorrect key used when the user joined the channel. Please check the key entered when joining the channel or guide the user to try rejoining the channel.
121: Invalid user ID.

122: Data stream decryption failed. Possibly due to an incorrect key used when the user joined the channel. Please check the key entered when joining the channel or guide the user to try rejoining the channel.
123: The user is banned by the server.
130: The SDK does not support pushing encrypted streams to the CDN.
134: Invalid user account, possibly due to invalid parameters.
200: Unsupported PCM format.
201: Buffer overflow due to PCM sending rate being too fast.
1001: Failed to load media engine.
1005: Audio device error (unspecified). Please check whether the audio device is occupied by another application or try rejoining the channel.
1008: Failed to initialize playback device. Please check whether the playback device is occupied by another application or try rejoining the channel.
1009: Failed to start playback device. Please check whether the playback device is functioning properly.
1010: Failed to stop playback device.
1011: Failed to initialize recording device. Please check whether the recording device is functioning properly or try rejoining the channel.
1012: Failed to start recording device. Please check whether the recording device is functioning properly.
1013: Failed to stop recording device.
1501: No permission to use the camera. Please check whether camera permission is enabled.
0: No error.
1: A general error (no specific classification). Please retry the method call.
2: Invalid parameter set in the method. For example, the specified channel name contains illegal characters. Please reset the parameter.

3: The SDK is not ready. Possible reasons include:
initialization failed. Please reinitialize .
The user has not joined a channel when calling the method. Please check the method call logic.
The user has not left the channel when calling or . Please check the method call logic.
The audio module is not enabled.
The assembly is incomplete.

4: The current state of does not support this operation. Possible reasons include:
When using built-in encryption, the encryption mode is incorrect, or loading the external encryption library failed. Please check if the encryption enumeration value is correct, or reload the external encryption library.

5: This method call was rejected. Possible reasons include:
initialization failed. Please reinitialize .
The channel name was set to an empty string "" when joining the channel. Please reset the channel name.
In multi-channel scenarios, the specified channel name already exists when calling to join the channel. Please reset the channel name.
6: The buffer size is insufficient to hold the returned data.
7: The method is called before is initialized. Please ensure the object is created and initialized before calling this method.
8: The current state is invalid.
9: No permission to operate. Please check whether the user has granted the app access to audio and video devices.
10: The method call timed out. Some method calls require the SDK to return a result. If the SDK takes too long (over 10 seconds) to process the event, this error occurs.

17: Joining the channel was rejected. Possible reasons include:
The user is already in the channel. It is recommended to determine whether the user is in the channel through the callback. Do not call this method again to join the channel unless receiving the ConnectionStateDisconnected(1) state.
The user attempted to join a channel after calling for a call test without first calling to end the current test. After starting a call test, you must call to end the test before joining a channel.

18: Failed to leave the channel. Possible reasons include:
The user has already left the channel before calling . Just stop calling this method.
The user called to exit the channel without having joined it. No further action is needed in this case.
19: The resource is already in use and cannot be reused.
20: The SDK aborted the request, possibly due to too many requests.
21: Specific firewall settings on Windows caused initialization to fail and crash.
22: The SDK failed to allocate resources, possibly due to excessive resource usage by the app or system resource exhaustion.
101: Invalid App ID. Please use a valid App ID to rejoin the channel.
102: Invalid channel name. Possible reason is incorrect data type for the parameter. Please use a valid channel name to rejoin the channel.
103: Unable to acquire server resources in the current region. Try specifying another region when initializing .

109: The current Token has expired and is no longer valid. Please request a new Token from your server and call to update it. Deprecated: This enumeration is deprecated. Use ConnectionChangedTokenExpired(9) in the callback instead.

pd.note: Deprecated: This enumeration is deprecated. Use ConnectionChangedInvalidToken(8) in the callback instead.

ul.li: App certificate is enabled in the console, but App ID + Token authentication is not used. When the App certificate is enabled, Token authentication must be used.
The uid field used when generating the Token does not match the uid used when the user joins the channel.

0: No error.
1: General error (uncategorized error cause). Please try calling the method again.
2: Invalid parameter set in the method. For example, the specified channel name contains illegal characters. Please reset the parameters.

3: SDK is not ready. Possible reasons include:
initialization failed. Please reinitialize .
User has not joined the channel when calling the method. Please check the method call logic.
User has not left the channel when calling or . Please check the method call logic.
Audio module is not enabled.
Incomplete assembly.

4: The current state of does not support this operation. Possible reasons include:
When using built-in encryption, the encryption mode is incorrect or loading the external encryption library failed. Please check whether the encryption enum value is correct or reload the external encryption library.

5: This method call was rejected. Possible reasons include:
initialization failed. Please reinitialize .
An empty string "" was set as the channel name when joining the channel. Please reset the channel name.
In multi-channel scenarios, the specified channel name already exists when calling to join a channel. Please reset the channel name.
6: Buffer size is insufficient to hold the returned data.
7: Method is called before is initialized. Please ensure that the object is created and initialized before calling this method.
8: Invalid current state.
9: No permission to operate. Please check whether the user has granted the app permission to use audio and video devices.
10: Method call timed out. Some method calls require a result from the SDK. If the SDK takes too long to process the event and does not return within 10 seconds, this error occurs.

17: Joining the channel was rejected. Possible reasons include:
The user is already in the channel. It is recommended to determine whether the user is in the channel via the callback. Do not call this method again to join the channel unless receiving the connectionStateDisconnected(1) state.
After calling for a call test, the user attempts to join the channel without calling to end the current test. After starting the call test, you must call to end the test before joining the channel.

18: Failed to leave the channel. Possible reasons include:
The user has already left the channel before calling . Stop calling this method.
The user calls to exit the channel without having joined it. No further action is needed in this case.
19: The resource is already in use and cannot be reused.
20: SDK aborted the request, possibly due to too many requests.
21: Specific firewall settings on Windows caused initialization to fail and crash.
22: SDK failed to allocate resources, possibly because the app is using too many resources or system resources are exhausted.
101: Invalid App ID. Please use a valid App ID to rejoin the channel.
102: Invalid channel name. Possible reason is incorrect data type set for the parameter. Please use a valid channel name to rejoin the channel.
103: Unable to obtain server resources in the current region. Try specifying a different region when initializing .

109: The current Token has expired and is no longer valid. Please request a new Token from the server and call to update it. Deprecated: This enum is deprecated. Use connectionChangedTokenExpired(9) in the callback instead.

pd.note: Deprecated: This enum is deprecated. Use connectionChangedInvalidToken(8) in the callback instead.

ul.li: App certificate is enabled in the console, but App ID + Token authentication is not used. When the project enables the App certificate, Token authentication must be used.
The uid field used when generating the Token does not match the uid used when the user joins the channel.

plentry.pd: 111: Network connection interrupted. SDK lost network connection for more than 4 seconds after establishing a connection with the server.
112: Network connection lost. The network was interrupted and the SDK could not reconnect to the server within 10 seconds.
113: User is not in the channel when calling the method.

1001: Failed to load media engine.
1005: Audio device error (unspecified). Please check whether the audio device is occupied by another application, or try rejoining the channel.
1008: Error initializing playback device. Please check whether the playback device is occupied by another application, or try rejoining the channel.
1009: Error starting playback device. Please check whether the playback device is functioning properly.
1010: Error stopping playback device.
1011: Error initializing recording device. Please check whether the recording device is functioning properly, or try rejoining the channel.
1012: Error starting recording device. Please check whether the recording device is functioning properly.
1013: Error stopping recording device.
1501: No permission to use the camera. Please check whether camera permission is enabled.
0: No error.
1: A general error (no specific classification of the cause). Please try calling the method again.
2: Invalid parameter set in the method. For example, the specified channel name contains illegal characters. Please reset the parameters.

3: SDK is not ready. Possible reasons include:
initialization failed. Please reinitialize .
User has not joined the channel when calling the method. Please check the method call logic.
User has not left the channel when calling or . Please check the method call logic.
Audio module is not enabled.
Incomplete assembly.

4: The current state of does not support the operation. Possible reasons include:
When using built-in encryption, the encryption mode is incorrect, or loading the external encryption library failed. Please check whether the encryption enum value is correct or reload the external encryption library.

5: This method call was rejected. Possible reasons include:
initialization failed. Please reinitialize .
Channel name is set to an empty string "" when joining the channel. Please reset the channel name.
In multi-channel scenarios, the specified channel name already exists when calling . Please reset the channel name.
6: Buffer size is insufficient to hold the returned data.
7: method called before initialization. Please ensure that the object is created and initialized before calling the method.
8: Invalid current state.
9: No permission to operate. Please check whether the user has granted the app permission to use audio and video devices.
10: Method call timed out. Some method calls require a result from the SDK. If the SDK takes too long (over 10 seconds) to respond, this error occurs.

17: Join channel request rejected. Possible reasons include:
User is already in the channel. It is recommended to use the callback to determine whether the user is in the channel. Do not call this method again to join the channel unless receiving CONNECTION_STATE_DISCONNECTED(1).
After calling for a call test, the user tries to join a channel without first calling to end the test. You must call before joining a channel.

18: Failed to leave the channel. Possible reasons include:
User has already left the channel before calling . You can stop calling this method.
User has not joined the channel but calls . No additional action is required in this case.
19: Resource already in use and cannot be reused.
20: SDK aborted the request, possibly due to too many requests.
21: On Windows, specific firewall settings cause initialization to fail and crash.
22: SDK failed to allocate resources, possibly due to excessive app resource usage or system resource exhaustion.
101: Invalid App ID. Please use a valid App ID to rejoin the channel.
102: Invalid channel name. Possible reason is incorrect data type of the parameter. Please use a valid channel name to rejoin the channel.
103: Unable to acquire server resources in the current region. Try specifying a different region when initializing .

109: The current Token has expired and is no longer valid. Please request a new Token from the server and call to update it. Deprecated: This enum is deprecated. Use CONNECTION_CHANGED_TOKEN_EXPIRED(9) in the callback instead.

pd.note: Deprecated: This enum is deprecated. Use CONNECTION_CHANGED_INVALID_TOKEN(8) in the callback instead.

ul.li: App certificate is enabled in the console, but App ID + Token authentication is not used. When the project enables the App certificate, Token authentication must be used.
The uid field used to generate the Token does not match the uid used when the user joins the channel.

plentry.pd: 111: Network connection interrupted. SDK lost connection for more than 4 seconds after establishing a connection with the server.
112: Network connection lost. Connection interrupted and SDK fails to reconnect to the server within 10 seconds.
113: User is not in the channel when calling .
114: Data length exceeds 1 KB when calling .
115: Data sending frequency exceeds the limit (6 KB/s) when calling .
116: Number of data streams exceeds the limit (5) when calling .
117: Data stream sending timed out.
119: Failed to switch user role. Please try rejoining the channel.
120: Media stream decryption failed. Possibly due to incorrect key used when joining the channel. Please check the key entered when joining or guide the user to rejoin the channel.
121: Invalid user ID.
122: Data stream decryption failed. Possibly due to incorrect key used when joining the channel. Please check the key entered when joining or guide the user to rejoin the channel.
